department: Department of Public Works and Government Services (PSPC)
short_summary: perform the inspection and repairs of children's playspaces and equipment
description: The work involves inspecting and repairing children's playspaces and equipment at CFB Halifax. Technical inquiries and contractual questions should be submitted in writing to the contracting authority. Inquiries should be made at least 5 days before the closing date to allow enough time for a response.
full_summary:
== Government Tender Announcement ==

### Overview

The Department of Public Works and Government Services (PSPC) is soliciting proposals from qualified contractors for the provision of inspection services for children's play spaces and equipment at various areas of Canadian Forces Base Halifax (CFB Halifax).

### Tender Details

* **Tender Reference Number**: WS4102274296
* **Publication Date**: July 18, 2023
* **Tender Closing Date**: August 15, 2023, at 2:00 PM EST
* **Expected Contract Start Date**: October 1, 2023
* **Expected Contract End Date**: N/A

### Solicitation

This tender is issued under the Request for Proposal (RFP) process, and the selected contractor will be awarded the contract based on the lowest price.

### Tender Documents

The requested tender documents are available on the federal government's procurement portal, [Discovery](http://discovery.ariba.com/rfx/16903686?extsite=MTY5MDM2ODZfQU4wMTQ4NDA1MDk5Mg==).

### Contact Information

For technical and contractual inquiries, please submit your questions in writing to:
Richard Parsons
Department of Public Works and Government Services (PSPC)
Email: [richard.parsons@tpsgc-pwgsc.gc.ca](mailto:richard.parsons@tpsgc-pwgsc.gc.ca)
Inquiries must be submitted no later than five (5) calendar days prior to the closing date to allow sufficient time for a response.

### Trade Agreements

This tender is subject to various trade agreements, including the World Trade Organization Agreement on Government Procurement (WTO GPA) and the Comprehensive and Progressive Agreement for Trans-Pacific Partnership (CPTPP).

### Services Required

The selected contractor will be responsible for providing inspection services for children's play spaces and equipment at various areas of CFB Halifax, as well as any necessary repairs.

### Regions of Delivery

The contractor must be capable of performing the services in the province of Nova Scotia.

### Contacting the Contracting Authority

Inquiries regarding this tender should be directed to Richard Parsons, email: [richard.parsons@tpsgc-pwgsc.gc.ca](mailto:richard.parsons@tpsgc-pwgsc.gc.ca).

+] Catégories : 911 Sécurité_Publique
